channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Donald Trump, You Lucky Dog
item.description: It’s unnerving how many fortuitous things have happened to this guy.

item.title: The Real Loser of the V.P. Debate
Dutch airline KLM will do ‘everything’ it can to protect jobs in cost-cutting drive
item.description: KLM CEO Marjan Rintel said the measures would be "painful for every KLM colleague, but it is necessary, and it has to be done now."

item.title: Amid Sanctions, Russian Oil Tankers Are Flying New Flags
item.description: A shadowy network of ships has registered in Gabon, highlighting how Vladimir V. Putin is building an economy beyond the reach of Western sanctions.

item.title: Who has time for a power lunch? The real business happens at 4 P.M. ‘power hour.’
item.description: In the post-covid era, the bars of some of Manhattan's most elegant restaurants are packed by 4:30 p.m. Just don't call it "happy hour."

item.title: Typhoon Krathon Makes Landfall in Taiwan, Bringing Drenching Rains
item.description: Two people have been killed and more than 10,000 evacuated, the authorities said. The downpour has triggered landslides and flooding.

item.title: Typhoon Krathon Makes Landfall in Taiwan, Bringing Drenching Rains
item.description: Two people have been killed and more than 10,000 evacuated, the authorities said. The downpour has triggered landslides and flooding.

item.title: After Successes, Israel’s Military Is in a ‘Long Game’ With No Clear Outcome
item.description: A year after perhaps the worst military and intelligence debacle in the country’s history, its armed forces have regained the momentum. Some ask: to w...

item.title: Turkish inflation on a downward trend—a delight for consumers but a disappointment for policymakers
item.description: Turkish annual inflation slowed less than expected in September to 49.4%.

item.title: Abuse Claims Add to Telegram C.E.O. Pavel Durov’s Legal Troubles
item.description: The mother of three children with Pavel Durov has poked holes in the Russian tech titan’s carefully managed image through a criminal complaint and her...

item.title: Stocks rise in Japan while the yen and U.K. pound fall on dovish interest rate talk
item.description: Japan jumped while Hong Kong and Europe stumbled as Israel pushed into Lebanon and Middle East tensions grew. China’s markets remained closed for Gold...

item.title: World Braces for Bigger Trade Wars if Trump Wins
item.description: Business owners and foreign governments are preparing for high tariffs and trade disruptions, depending on the outcome of the election.

item.title: WNBA commissioner Cathy Engelbert is leading the league to historic highs. Critics wonder if she’s fully seizing the moment
item.description: As the WNBA's banner season wraps up, Engelbert faces more pressure than ever.

item.title: Why Israel Is Worried About Iran’s Nuclear Ambitions
item.description: Despite the supreme leader’s stated religious objections to nuclear weapons, Tehran has been steadily making progress on its nuclear weapons capabilit...

item.title: In Japan’s Countryside, Century-Old Firms Learn to Embrace Foreign Workers
item.description: Japan’s regional economies are facing severe labor shortages. Their survival depends on their ability to persuade foreign workers to stay.
